intro: Cryptantha dicarpa, commonly known as the two-seeded cryptantha, is a flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to the western United States and grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. The plant produces small, delicate blue or purple flowers that bloom in early spring. Its fruit is a slender, two-lobed pod that splits open to release seeds. Cryptantha dicarpa is often found in arid environments and is adapted to thrive in low-nutrient soils.
